content.original: The "Argent Leviathan" was commissioned by ComStar in 3060 as an exploratory upgrade to existing King Crabs. Largely driven by the logistical problems plaguing ComStar's thinly stretched armies, the KGC-AL prototype would carry eight extended range medium lasers and two large pulse lasers along with functional claws that would enable it to drag large battlefield salvage or even grasp its prey. Quirk: Command Mech Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.22

content.original:
The Clint was first created in 2607 as a direct result of the Star LeagueArmaments Act, a law meant to provide border areas with the latest in battlefield technology. The next version, CLNT-2-3T, was mass produced starting in 2608. The Clint was primarily designed as a cheap recon unit, with the capabilities of a well-armed, low-end medium weight 'Mech, and in this regard it served well. With a top speed of 97.2 km/h and a jumping capability of one hundred and eighty meters, the Clint can easily keep up with other recon elements and maneuver through mountainous or urban terrain. Its Sloan 220 Lockover T&T System in particular shines as it is simple to use and provides the pilot with excellent battlefield data. Although the 'Mech has limited ammunition reserves for its autocannon, the Sloane 220 ensures that whatever the Clintshoots at, it hits. Quirk: Variable Range Targeting Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.14

Arm Actuator Limit: Right Lower

content.original: The Kugelblitz, also known as the Hypernova, Superluminous Supernova, or 'Type 1A Supernova' is a gigantic Supernova chassis. Nothing really out of the ordinary until one checks the armor plating on it, mounting WarShip class 'Ferro-Carbide Lamellor', this expensive armor is capable of protecting a 'Mech's internals without issue, but the price to maintain the armor is something even the richest of Clan Diamond Shark might have an issue with. Quirk: Improved Targeting - Long Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.38

content.original:
The variant piloted by Phelan Wolf at his Trial of Position to test out as a MechWarrior on 21 July 3051. Configured by Khan Natasha Kerensky (who was piloting the LRM variant of her Widowmaker in the same Trial). For long range, the Lone Wolf variant was armed with shoulder mounted twin LRM-20 launchers with 24 racks, first half being Swarm LRMs, backed up by a Gauss Rifle in left arm, with 16 slug coming from bins in the left torso. For close combat, the Lone Wolf carries three Medium Pulse Lasers in right arm, a stubby LB-X Autocannon/20 with 10 cluster rounds under-slung on right torso. Quirk: Improved Targeting - Long Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.26

Arm Actuator Limits: Omni

content.original:
This Marauder, commonly reffered as the MAD-DER, was first seen as a Solaris VII speed boosted refit which boasts of an L.A.M. System incorporated to the very mech's chassis and engine, enabling it to go faster and actually fly in short bursts, but doesn't make it an actual ''L.A.M.'', at most it can jump and glide. The procedure changed it to have much better jumping and DFA targetting, perfect for its role as a disabler and a DFA gladiator on Solaris matches. And since it's Solaris VII debut many other expressed their interest in a Heavy Mech with L.A.M.-like capabilites but no other vendors were interested in making such a niche design replicated unless they have deep enough pockets to build something of their own. And while a few who still persevered. This mech was mainly made with the kind of passion for a flying Marauder, whose design was quickly stolen, modified and refitted with several disabler weapons. A terrifying beast for a good pilot. Quirk: LAM-like Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.19

Arm Actuator Limits: Left Lower, Right Lower

content.original: This Marauder, commonly refered as the MAD-DER, was first seen as a Solaris VII speed boosted refit which boasts of a L.A.M. System incorporated to the very mech's chassis and engine, enabling it to go faster and actually fly in short bursts. In botched attempt to make a Marauder into a L.A.M. the armor and it's unique JJ system got fused into the chassis making it impossible to make heavy modifications to the mech. I guess some sacrifices needed to be made for a 75-Ton ''Flying'' mech.

content.original: In its primary configuration the Summoner has a basic yet effective arsenal. The primary direct fire weapon is an ER PPC backed up by an LB 10-X Autocannon that can fire both standard and cluster ammunition. content.original: All 'Mechs come equipped with a stock targeting and tracking system—or TTS—which can be upgraded for improved performance. Upgrades increase accuracy when attacking with Ballistic, Energy, or Missile weaponry, depending on the type of TTS. Doesn't stack with same type but different tiers do.
content.prevOriginal: All 'Mechs come equipped with a stock targeting and tracking system—or TTS—which can be upgraded for improved performance. Upgrades increase accuracy when attacking with Ballistic, Energy, or Missile weaponry, depending on the type of TTS. Doesn't stack with same type but different tiers do.
content.content: Все мехи оснащены стандартной системой прицеливания и слежения - или TTS, - которую можно модернизировать для улучшения характеристик. Модификации повышают точность при атаке баллистическим, энергетическим или ракетным оружием, в зависимости от типа TTS. Не складывается с одним и тем же типом, но складывается с другими.

content.original: The "Argent Leviathan" was commissioned by ComStar in 3060 as an exploratory upgrade to existing King Crabs. Largely driven by the logistical problems plaguing ComStar's thinly stretched armies, the KGC-AL prototype would carry eight extended range medium lasers and two large pulse lasers along with functional claws that would enable it to drag large battlefield salvage or even grasp its prey. Quirk: Command Mech Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.22

content.original:
The Clint was first created in 2607 as a direct result of the Star LeagueArmaments Act, a law meant to provide border areas with the latest in battlefield technology. The next version, CLNT-2-3T, was mass produced starting in 2608. The Clint was primarily designed as a cheap recon unit, with the capabilities of a well-armed, low-end medium weight 'Mech, and in this regard it served well. With a top speed of 97.2 km/h and a jumping capability of one hundred and eighty meters, the Clint can easily keep up with other recon elements and maneuver through mountainous or urban terrain. Its Sloan 220 Lockover T&T System in particular shines as it is simple to use and provides the pilot with excellent battlefield data. Although the 'Mech has limited ammunition reserves for its autocannon, the Sloane 220 ensures that whatever the Clintshoots at, it hits. Quirk: Variable Range Targeting Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.14

Arm Actuator Limit: Right Lower

content.original: The Kugelblitz, also known as the Hypernova, Superluminous Supernova, or 'Type 1A Supernova' is a gigantic Supernova chassis. Nothing really out of the ordinary until one checks the armor plating on it, mounting WarShip class 'Ferro-Carbide Lamellor', this expensive armor is capable of protecting a 'Mech's internals without issue, but the price to maintain the armor is something even the richest of Clan Diamond Shark might have an issue with. Quirk: Improved Targeting - Long Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.38

content.original:
The variant piloted by Phelan Wolf at his Trial of Position to test out as a MechWarrior on 21 July 3051. Configured by Khan Natasha Kerensky (who was piloting the LRM variant of her Widowmaker in the same Trial). For long range, the Lone Wolf variant was armed with shoulder mounted twin LRM-20 launchers with 24 racks, first half being Swarm LRMs, backed up by a Gauss Rifle in left arm, with 16 slug coming from bins in the left torso. For close combat, the Lone Wolf carries three Medium Pulse Lasers in right arm, a stubby LB-X Autocannon/20 with 10 cluster rounds under-slung on right torso. Quirk: Improved Targeting - Long Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.26

Arm Actuator Limits: Omni

content.original:
This Marauder, commonly reffered as the MAD-DER, was first seen as a Solaris VII speed boosted refit which boasts of an L.A.M. System incorporated to the very mech's chassis and engine, enabling it to go faster and actually fly in short bursts, but doesn't make it an actual ''L.A.M.'', at most it can jump and glide. The procedure changed it to have much better jumping and DFA targetting, perfect for its role as a disabler and a DFA gladiator on Solaris matches. And since it's Solaris VII debut many other expressed their interest in a Heavy Mech with L.A.M.-like capabilites but no other vendors were interested in making such a niche design replicated unless they have deep enough pockets to build something of their own. And while a few who still persevered. This mech was mainly made with the kind of passion for a flying Marauder, whose design was quickly stolen, modified and refitted with several disabler weapons. A terrifying beast for a good pilot. Quirk: LAM-like Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.19

Arm Actuator Limits: Left Lower, Right Lower

And since it's Solaris VII debut many other expressed their interest in a Heavy Mech with L.A.M.-like capabilites but no other vendors were interested in making such a niche design replicated unless they have deep enough pockets to build something of their own. And while a few who still persevered. This mech was mainly made with the kind of passion for a flying Marauder, whose design was quickly stolen, modified and refitted with several disabler weapons. A terrifying beast for a good pilot. Quirk: LAM-like Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.21

content.original: The Railgun is a massive weapon adapted from WarShips to be used on BattleMechs. Clan technology has allowed such a massive weapon to fit a relative small space. The powerful weapon decimates enemy 'Mechs with a single, well-placed shot, but only a few 'Mechs are able to mount. This one was specially downscaled for Assault mechs on the CT. Experimental close range firemode unlocked. Uses Railgun Ammo. VOLATILE!

content.original: The latest Railgun variant downscaled set to mountable into normal mech sized mech chassis. This versions brings a lot more improvements and a radical change in space conservation. The downside to this radical of an upgrade, is that the mech used in this, the Stone Rhino - R, has this permanently affixed into the chassis, sacrificing adaptability for role specialization. A specialized CASE system that spreads its capacitors safely around the torso makes it safer to use. Experimental close range firemode unlocked. Uses Railgun Ammo.

content.original:
A clan prototype of an even more improved Rifleman III RF2-A, further improved by a group of Clan Coyote scientists that would eventually turn into the Society. The changes start already on the chassis level by using a Composite structure, mounting a 280 XXL engine and special recoil reducing arm actuators. To utilize the actuators fully the 'Mech mounts one LB-X AC/2 and one Rotary AC/10 in each arm. Further, it uses Stealth armor, a Nova CEWS and UAV to win any sensor war to be able to get close enough to obliterate its enemies. To aid the pilot, a VR cockpit with Enhance Imaging support, and a high-end Fire Control System. Quirk: Anti-Air Targeting Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.28

Arm Actuator Limits: Left Upper, Right Upper

content.original: Directional Thruster (MAD-DER)
content.content: Directional Thruster (MAD-DER)

content.original: This specially modified directional thruster modified for the special MAD-DER Marauder variant works in conjunction with the L.A.M. system strapped into the mech's chassis, while it wasn't possible to remove all the weight cost from the thruster, its lighter then its normal counterparts. But due to the procedure, it has been linked directly into the engine core, making it impossible to be removed without risking either destroying the engine enclosure or the thruster, but its destruction won't affect the engine core itself due to the extra bulk and safeguards.
content.prevOriginal: This specially modified directional thruster modified for the special MAD-DER Marauder variant works in conjunction with the LAM system strapped into the mech's chassis, while it wasn't possible to remove all the weight cost from the thruster, its lighter then its normal counterparts. content.original: FCS HAG
content.content: FCS HAG

content.original: All 'Mechs come equipped with a stock targeting and tracking system—or TTS—which can be upgraded for improved performance. Upgrades increase accuracy when attacking with Ballistic, Energy, or Missile weaponry, depending on the type of TTS. Doesn't stack with same type but different tiers do.
content.prevOriginal: All 'Mechs come equipped with a stock targeting and tracking system—or TTS—which can be upgraded for improved performance. Upgrades increase accuracy when attacking with Ballistic, Energy, or Missile weaponry, depending on the type of TTS. Doesn't stack with same type but different tiers do.
content.content: Все мехи оснащены стандартной системой прицеливания и слежения - или TTS, - которую можно модернизировать для улучшения характеристик. Модификации повышают точность при атаке баллистическим, энергетическим или ракетным оружием, в зависимости от типа TTS. Не складывается с одним и тем же типом, но складывается с другими.

content.original: The BattleMech Vibroblade was developed by Draconis Combine engineers. Using their Sword as a foundation, they were able to incorporate the same technology that makes the personal vibroblade and vibrokatana so effective. This Vibroblade is augmented by an Actuator Enhancement System. This Sword prototype is affixed permanently to the 'Mech’s arm.

content.original: Railgun (DS)
content.content: Railgun (DS)

content.original: The Railgun is a massive weapon adapted from WarShips to be used on BattleMechs. Clan technology has allowed such a massive weapon to fit a relative small space. The powerful weapon decimates enemy 'Mechs with a single, well-placed shot, but only a few 'Mechs are able to mount. This one was specially downscaled for Assault mechs on the CT. Experimental close range firemode unlocked. Uses Railgun Ammo. VOLATILE!

content.original: Railgun (SR)
content.content: Railgun (SR)

content.original: The latest Railgun variant downscaled set to mountable into normal mech sized mech chassis. This versions brings a lot more improvements and a radical change in space conservation. The downside to this radical of an upgrade, is that the mech used in this, the Stone Rhino - R, has this permanently affixed into the chassis, sacrificing adaptability for role specialization. A specialized CASE system that spreads its capacitors safely around the torso makes it safer to use. Experimental close range firemode unlocked. Uses Railgun Ammo.

content.original:
A clan prototype of an even more improved Rifleman III RF2-A, further improved by a group of Clan Coyote scientists that would eventually turn into the Society. The changes start already on the chassis level by using a Composite structure, mounting a 280 XXL engine and special recoil reducing arm actuators. To utilize the actuators fully the 'Mech mounts one LB-X AC/2 and one Rotary AC/10 in each arm. Further, it uses Stealth armor, a Nova CEWS and UAV to win any sensor war to be able to get close enough to obliterate its enemies. To aid the pilot, a VR cockpit with Enhance Imaging support, and a high-end Fire Control System. Quirk: Anti-Air Targeting Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.28

Arm Actuator Limits: Left Upper, Right Upper

content.original: Ferro-Carbide Lamellor (C)
content.content: Ferro-Carbide Lamellor (C)

content.original: One of Clan Diamond Shark's latest projects, this mech armour variant of the Ferro-Carbide Lamellor is capable of protecting a mech's internal with the best technology possible available until now on WarShips. While its huge advantages make it very desirable, the cost of this armor is quite extreme, being 100 times more expensive then regular Warship armor. This armor uses fixed slots, 2 slots on LA/LT/RT/RA and 1 slot on Head/CT/LL/RL CASE II Enabled

content.original: Titano-Carbide Lamellor (C)
content.content: Titano-Carbide Lamellor (C)

content.original: The latest evolution of clan armor, a project combining the work of Clan Diamond Shark around ferro-carbide lamellor armor with Clan Coyote's forray into Superheavy Mechs. Not much is known about the actual manufacturing process, but compund analysis of armord shards found on the battlefield seems to point towards a further evolution of the Ferro-Fibrous armor, which almost entirely removes the steel to lower the weight of the armor considerably. This can not be the only secret behind the armor, as previous attempts to produce similar materials proved far too fragile for use as battlemech armor.

content.original: Ryuujin Superheavy Flamer
content.content: Ryuujin Superheavy Flamer

content.original: Developed by Howa Machinery Company Ltd. for the King Dragon, the experimental Ryujin Superheavy Flamer utilizes a totally new concept for delivery of the flammable substance. The weapon charges a 'cloud' of inert nano-particles with an positive charge, which then binds a special ionized highly flammable substance between the particles. Upon impact with a surface the bindings of the nano-particles and the flammable substance are broken, resulting in the ignition of the fluid by the released electrical charge. This allows the flamer to reach much further distances, but also means the heat explosion is considerably less at shorter distances as the kinetic impact will rupture less of the bindings. If the weapon is handled incorrectly it could lead to an incorrect charging sequence resulting in the flammable substance igniting upon firing, causing a large heat explosion. Uses Superheavy Flamer Ammo.

content.original: Rotary Gauss Rifle (C)
content.content: Rotary Gauss Rifle (C)

content.original: A Clan Wolverine prototype Rotary Gauss Rifle. First Conceptualized on Project Omega, now added into a RACzilla's chassis. Generates a lot more heat for each shot fired. Has a special ''Overload'' mode, this mode shots a single superheated gauss shot which causes heavy damage to any targets, using this mode is normally not recommended since it causes heavy stress on the weapon, but helps in saving ammo. Uses Gauss Ammo. REALLY VOLATILE!

Uses RAPLBGR Ammo. ВЗРЫВООПАСНО!

content.content: SB Gauss (C)

content.original: Mauler Laser
content.content: Mauler Laser

content.original: A highly experimental super-heavy laser, developed by a black ops skunkworks division of Kali Yama. The Mauler is a brute-force energy projector that fires a massive bolt of unrestrained destruction with a wide area of effect. The Mauler almost always strikes its target, but has very limited range and needs a long time to cool down between shots. Its very high power usage and heavy strain on hardware when firing makes the Mauler practically need a custom built chassis for mounting. VERY UNSTABLE AND VOLATILE!

content.original: Naval Laser (Downsized)
content.content: Naval Laser (Downsized)

content.original: In an attempt to improve the damage potential of superheavy 'Mechs the researchers at StarYard Laboratories took a Naval-class Laser and downsized the weapon until it fit on the chassis of a 'Mech. After some initial issues during the first field trials, a series of frequency modulators and micro-microphase resonators were added resulting in a pulse-like firing pattern. The results were promising enough that a limited production series was run, and although rare the weapon can now be found throughout the galaxy.

content.original: Rotary LRM-20
content.content: Rotary LRM-20

content.original: An experimental rotary missile launcher enabling firing up to three salvos in very short sequence from the 20 visible tubes. Due to issues with internal rotation mechanism jamming constantly and sometimes even misfiring, the weapon is considered highly unreliable and a failure by the MechWarriors that have trialed it. Since the launcher has to preload the ammunition into the rotary system, there is a chance of explosion if the weapon is damaged. VOLATILE!

content.original: Yin Rotary PPC
content.content: Yin Rotary PPC

content.original: The Yin is an experimental Rotary PPC, capable of firing one, two or three shots. To not overload the circuitry of the 'Mech when firing in the multi-shot modes, the Rotary PPC pre-loads a large amount of capacitors with the energy needed. As a result the Yin is a very large weapon that can only be mounted on superheavy 'Mechs.

content.original: Helical Railgun
content.content: Helical Railgun

content.original: The Helical Railgun is Clan Steel Viper's recent weapons technology, a further advancement of the standard linear Railgun by combining it with the latest coilgun advancements. The coils are used to charge the firing mechanism considerably faster than normal, allowing the weapon to switch between either a long range, higher damage, single shot attack, or a multi-firing sequence with two or three shots. However, due to the technology limitations the the weapon still is prohibitively heavy and large and can only fit on the largest BattleMechs, and is also prone to misfire if not the proper firing sequence of seven precise steps is used. Uses Helical Railgun Ammo. EXTREMELY VOLATILE!

content.original: Improved Railgun (C)
content.content: Improved Railgun (C)

content.original: The Improved Railgun is a recent creation of the Clans, using the latest Clan technology to further lower its weight. The result is a smaller and lighter weapon, that still manages to retain or even improve upon the typical characteristics of the original except for its range. To compensate for the shorter range, a new special firing mode has been developed that increases the range considerably at the cost of less damage by undercharging the firing rail. Uses Railgun Ammo. VOLATILE!

content.original: Plasma Railgun
content.content: Plasma Railgun

content.original: Originally a failed project by Free Worlds League for a Coaxial Hyper Velocity Railgun, ComStar acquired the technology in secret and adapted it fire plasma instead. A plasma railgun is similar to the more commonly known projectile railgun, however, the armature and ejected projectile consists of plasma, or hot, ionized, gas-like particles, instead of a solid slug of material. This produces muzzle velocities of up to several hundreds of kilometers per second, and a huge heat buildup on impact. Uses Plasma Railgun Ammo. VOLATILE!

content.original: Accelerated AC/20
content.content: Accelerated AC/20

content.original: Prototype of a completely new auto cannon concept, the Accelerated Autocannon. Using complex feedback loops for the highly pressurized gases released when firing an autocannon, the speed of the projectile can be increased by almost the double. The result is a considerable increase in both damage and range. The weapon is however very suspectable to wear and tear and requires constant maintenance and care or the compressed gas tubes might explode, causing considerable damage to the firing unit. Due to the large increase in heat generated and the chance for internal explosions, the weapons system never saw any real use outside of the Scuti superheavy 'Mech. Uses AC20 Ammo.

content.original:
This experimental variant of the Archangel was based on salvaged schematics by Blake agents from the clans, building on experimental technology for both the clans and the inner sphere to produce a tactically superior weapons platform. The cost however to build this monstrosity limited it to just the prototype reaching full combat readiness. Quirk: Improved Communications Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.13

content.original: The 'Gaussinator' was the codename for the Society test platform for the Improved Gauss Rifle. Mounting a total of five of the weapons, two in each side torso and one in the center, allowed the 'Mech to either stagger fire or alpha strike as needed. Three Extended Range Lasers are also mounted as secondary firepower, and a Nova CEWS provides electronic warfare. Both side torsos also mount a Stabilized Housing, improving the Gauss Rifles' performance even further. Quirk: Intimidating Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.45

content.original: The lack of a Clan-made Superheavy QuadMech irked some of the more progressive scientists from the clans that had made it back to the Inner Sphere. So they decided to collaborate in secret on Project Colossus, meant to be the pinnacle of Clan design and ingenuity. The resulting 200 ton Quad OmniMech was eventually renamed to the Arachnid, and was more an ode to the decadence and delusion of grandeur that has started to seep into the Inner Sphere clans than fulfilling any practical role.

content.original: Oh man Boss, this thing is a dream to work on. Those Coyote scientists included all the design schematics, ammunition formulas, everything to make the mech, in multiple redundant data storage spots located around the mech. The spacious room to do maintenance is something I haven't seen since an Orion, and I feel totally fine handing it over to the newbie mechtechs, because it's just so idiot proof (knock on wood).  They even engraved the wiring schematics into the mech's frame! Heck, I'd even let Darius try repairing it! Ok, no, I wouldn't, because somehow he'd find some hostile BA in a leg or something and we'd have a fight inside the Argo, but you know what I mean.

content.original: The Tercio is the Escorpión_Imperio's flagship BattleMech. The 185 ton behemoth is focused on massive firepower and supporting it with advanced technology to maximize its efficiency. Although constructed only in limited numbers, the Tercio has quickly gained a reputation of being able to overwhelm even the most reinforced of positions.

content.original: Patchwork Materials Superheavy
content.content: Patchwork Materials Superheavy

content.original: This is a collection of patchwork materials (e.g. ferro-fibrous armour, endo steel structure, or ultralight composites) which provide the same degree of protection at a lighter weight, but at the cost of critical slots. This version is specifically made for Superheavy mechs, using some of the inherent benefits of a supersized chassis to reduce weight further.

content.original: Remote Delivery Magnetic Inhibitor Cannon
content.content: Remote Delivery Magnetic Inhibitor Cannon

content.original: The REDMIC, or REmote Delivery Magnetic Inhibitor Cannon, is a cutting edge experimental prototype weapon focused on delivering highly magnetically charged soft slugs onto enemy mechs. Upon impact the slug deforms and attaches itself to the target unit, causing their gyros to overload with resulting large stability issues. Developed by a former RISC team for the Scorpion Empire, the only currently known platform is specially modified Tercio Superheavy 'Mechs.

Лимит приводов рук: Left Upper, Right Upper

content.original: Heavy Juggernaut
content.content: Тяжёлый джаггернаут

content.original: The 170 ton Stalker IV superheavy 'Mech, or the SuperStalker as commonly known amongst MechWarriors, is the creation of the best minds at the Republic Institute for Strategic Combat (RISC). It is an attempt to convert the otherwise somewhat fragile Stalker to a true superheavy juggernaut, combining the experimental Superheavy Ferro-Alloy armor with a reinforced structure and a heavy duty gyro. All together this creates an extremely durable basis for the rest of the 'Mech, although limited in free space and available weight capacity.
content.prevOriginal: The 170 ton Stalker IV superheavy 'Mech, or the SuperStalker as commonly known amongst MechWarriors, is the creation of the best minds at the Republic Institute for Strategic Combat (RISC). It is an attempt to convert the otherwise somewhat fragile Stalker to a true superheavy juggernaut, combining the experimental Superheavy Ferro-Alloy armor with a reinforced structure and a heavy duty gyro. All together this creates an extremely durable basis for the rest of the 'Mech, although limited in free space and available weight capacity.
content.content: 170-тонный сверхтяжёлый мех Stalker IV, или SuperStalker, как его обычно называют мехвоины, - творение лучших умов Военно-стратегического института Республики (RISC). Это попытка превратить хрупкого «Сталкера» в настоящий сверхтяжёлый джаггернаут, сочетающий экспериментальную сверхтяжёлую ферросплавную броню с усиленным каркасом и сверхмощным гироскопом. Всё вместе создает чрезвычайно прочную основу для остальных компонентов меха, хотя и ограниченную в доступном внутреннем пространстве и свободном весе.

content.original:
The variant piloted by Phelan Wolf at his Trial of Position to test out as a MechWarrior on 21 July 3051. Configured by Khan Natasha Kerensky (who was piloting the LRM variant of her Widowmaker in the same Trial). For long range, the Lone Wolf variant was armed with shoulder mounted twin LRM-20 launchers with 24 racks, first half being Swarm LRMs, backed up by a Gauss Rifle in left arm, with 16 slug coming from bins in the left torso. For close combat, the Lone Wolf carries three Medium Pulse Lasers in right arm, a stubby LB-X Autocannon/20 with 10 cluster rounds under-slung on right torso. Quirk: Improved Targeting - Long Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.23

Arm Actuator Limits: Omni

content.original: The "Argent Leviathan" was commissioned by ComStar in 3060 as an exploratory upgrade to existing King Crabs. Largely driven by the logistical problems plaguing ComStar's thinly stretched armies, the KGC-AL prototype would carry eight extended range medium lasers and two large pulse lasers along with functional claws that would enable it to drag large battlefield salvage or even grasp its prey. Quirk: Command Mech Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.18

Largely driven by the logistical problems plaguing ComStar's thinly stretched armies, the KGC-AL prototype would carry eight extended range medium lasers and two large pulse lasers along with functional claws that would enable it to drag large battlefield salvage or even grasp its prey. Особенность: Командирский мех Множитель стоимости высадки: 1.18

content.original: The Alpha configuration of the Arachnid aims to provide indirect fire support, while still being able to survive staying near the frontline. Two huge Thunderbolt 20 launchers and four Streak LRM-20 launchers provide an impressive missile volley capability, able to overload even the most advanced anti-missile systems. Two center torso mounted Large ER Pulse Lasers allow some direct fire options as need arises, and a newly designed clan version of the Angel ECM enables electronic warfare support. To free up the weight capacity needed the armor has been converted to the latest Titano-Carbide Lamellor. Quirk: Intimidating Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.45

content.original: The lack of a Clan-made Superheavy QuadMech irked some of the more progressive scientists from the clans that had made it back to the Inner Sphere. So they decided to collaborate in secret on Project Colossus, meant to be the pinnacle of Clan design and ingenuity. The resulting 200 ton Quad OmniMech was eventually renamed to the Arachnid, and was more an ode to the decadence and delusion of grandeur that has started to seep into the Inner Sphere clans than fulfilling any practical role.

content.original: In an attempt to at lower the costs of the Arachnid primary configuration somewhat yet keep its alpha strike potential, the B loadout replaces the three Railguns with six standard Gauss Rifles and a total of 8 tons of Gauss ammunition. The two Extended Range PPCs were moved from the head to the center torso to benefit from the Quad Turret Mount. Quirk: Intimidating Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.45

content.original: The two massive railguns defines the Arachnid's primary configuration, both in appearance and in design. Even with the railguns taking up almost two thirds of the available internal space and weight capacity in the giant QuadMech, two ER PPC and an ER Large laser are mounted in the center torso to provide even more firepower. Using 33.5 tons of the latest Titano-Carbide Lamellor armor still allows more than enough armor to survive even the strongest attacks with just minor damages. Quirk: Intimidating Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.45

content.original: The only superheavy chassis Clan Widowmaker managed to design on their own, the Atrax is a 175 ton beast in the shape of a four-legged spider. Bringing all the strengths of a QuadMech and a Superheavy together, but at the cost of very limited mobility, the 'Mech was never favoured amongst the warriors of the Widowmaker touman, who only begrudgingly piloted the Superheavy. The strangest trait of the chassis are the four LRM-10 launchers that are constructed as a permanent part of the chassis, one in each knee.

content.original:
The Caracara 1 might not bring a lot of firepower for superheavy, only a Gauss Rifle in the right arm, an ATM-12 launcher in the left arm, a Heavy Medium Laser in each arm and finally a Large Pulse Laser. But by using a weapon mount on each arm, where most of the weapons are located, their performance is improved significantly, especially in combination with the added targeting computer. Quirk: Command Mech Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.39

Arm Actuator Limit: Left Lower

content.original: Built on the design of the Shrike, the Caracara is Clan Jade Falcons first foray into Superheavies. Packing a variation of advanced equipment for command, EWS and weapons targeting, the design is clearly aimed towards the Star Commanders of the Clan. The Caracara further keeps the jump capabilities of the Shrike by use of two Booster Jets and a Partial Wing System.

By having a full energy build, the Caracara 2 does suffer from cooling issues even with its 25 laser heat sinks if repeated alpha strikes are used. Особенность: Командирский мех Множитель стоимости высадки: 1.39

Лимит приводов рук: Left Lower

content.original: Superheavy Command Mech
content.content: Командирский мех

content.original: Built on the design of the Shrike, the Caracara is Clan Jade Falcons first foray into Superheavies. Packing a variation of advanced equipment for command, EWS and weapons targeting, the design is clearly aimed towards the Star Commanders of the Clan. The Caracara further keeps the jump capabilities of the Shrike by use of two Booster Jets and a Partial Wing System.

content.original:
As the early Caracara prototypes did prove vulnerable to battle armor or infantry attacks, the Caracara 3 is more defensively designed and mounts a Heavy Machine Gun array in each arm for scenarios where such foes are likely to appear. The design further brings an Advanced Laser AMS, a Mortar/8, an ER Large Laser and two Large ER Pulse Lasers. Quirk: Command Mech Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.39

Arm Actuator Limit: Left Lower

content.original:
After the testing failure of the Caracara 5 design, where two MechWarriors and several engineers were killed, the design was re-branded as the Caracara 6 but kept much of the same setup. Double MRM-40s and Large Improved Heavy Lasers are still the weapons of choice, but they have now been wired through stronger power conduits to not cause any further energy surges leading to ammo explosions. The 'Mech is now most likely completely safe to use according to its designers. Quirk: Command Mech Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.39

Arm Actuator Limit: Left Lower

content.original:
The Caracara X is the only variant to move away from the base concept of mounting Partial Wings for improved jump capabilities. Instead it was created to attach the fearsome Railgun to the chassis, with two iATM-9 launchers as complimentary armaments. The design is also the only one to not use a Ferro-Fibrous based armor, and instead uses the Clan Jade Falcon developed Glazed armor. Quirk: Command Mech Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.39

Arm Actuator Limit: Left Lower

content.original:
The first variant of the Charybdis is also the most versatile one. The combination of three ATM-9 launchers, four Pulse Lasers and the Ultra AC/10 means that together with the Helical Railgun the design is capable of delivering quite the punch at almost any kind of range. Quirk: Stable Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.49

Arm Actuator Limits: Left Lower, Right Lower

content.original:
The CHA-2 is one of the more self-reliable variants of the Charybdis as it is capable of self-defense with its two ER PPC and ER Large Laser in each arm. The heavy energy loadout does mean the design has to add 13 external heat sinks, leaving less space for weapons. Quirk: Stable Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.49

Arm Actuator Limits: Left Lower, Right Lower

content.original:
Outfitted for long range fire, the CHA-5 has no weapons to defend itself against fast flankers or infantry harassers. Even though it must thus be escorted at all times, the raw long range firepower of its railgun, gauss rifle, arrow IV and sniper Artillery means it can provide a serious amount of very long range support fire if protected from enemy forces. Quirk: Stable Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.49

Arm Actuator Limits: Left Lower, Right Lower

content.original:
The CHA-7 is the only model of the Charybdis with a small 250 rated engine core and compact instead of double heat sinks. But this in turn allows mounting a combination of an Improved Railgun to accompany the Helical. For more close combat the loadout mounts two Ultra AC/2s and a large ER Pulse Laser, with a backup ER Medium laser. The combined weapons profile is as a result quite varied and the 'Mech can handle most situations. Quirk: Stable Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.49

content.original: Created at an undisclosed factory by taking a King Crab and increasing it to 150 tons, the Emperor Crab is a ComStar creation to trials its latest acquire weapon - the Plasma Railgun. The 'Mech has been reported to be seen throughout the Inner Sphere, so the assumption is that ComStar have spread it for further trialing purposes.

content.original: A co-operation between Clan Sea Fox and Clan Nova Cat - mainly with resources from the latter, the Erebus is a specially designed chassis to mount the downsized Mass Driver - a giant ballistic weapon making autocannons look like pea shooters. The 'Mech has special stabilizing equipment and advanced targeting fire control systems, to attempt improving the Mass Driver performance. The 'Mech and its weapon is mostly seen as a waste of time by other Clans, as it is far too heavy and hot to be useful.

To be able to fit all the weapons and somewhat adequate cooling, the design uses an XXL engine, which leaves it more vulnerable to side torso penetration. Quirk: Stable Weapons Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.4

content.original: Clan Strike Superheavy
content.content: Клановый ударный сверхтяж

content.original: The Expunger is a 185 ton strike superheavy designed and fielded by Clan Wolverine. Any enemy is wise to never turn its back on an Expunger, as it is often used to bring their latest experimental weapons to the front - especially the Compact PPC. The Compact PPC is one of Clan Wolverine's most secret weapons, developed in parallel to the general Clan improvements of original Star League PPC technology. As a final touch, the torso mounted cockpit of the Expunger ensures the safety of the pilot, allowing the 'Mech's head to be fully utilized for Compact PPCs.

content.original:
The Expunger 3 was an attempt by Clan Wolverine to create a powerful Superheavy for urban combat, although the result was rated quite low by any warrior forced to pilot it. A total of eight Compact PPCs, four in the head and four in the center torso, are meant to deal a powerful and accurate initial strike, before eight SRM-6 launchers unleashes their missiles to fully penetrate the foe's armor. In reality the weapon setup is not accurate enough to actually fulfill this attack patterns in most cases. Quirk: Accurate Weapon - Energy Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.47

content.original: The Flawless might just look like an upscaled 130 ton Awesome, but under the surface there are some huge changes under the skin. In fact, a huge Ion Cannon prototype has been embedded in the 'Mechs chassis. In theory nothing more than an oversized PPC, this cannon is able to impair and shutdown the electronics of most BattleMechs with a single shot.

The -4E combines the mobility of a 400 XXL engine with the addition of two Extended LRM-10 launchers, for long range indirect fire, and the Heavy PPC. The variants cooling is inadequate for continuous fire with all weapons, so any MechWarrior piloting the 4E are recommend to consider their shots carefully. Quirk: Accurate Weapon - Missiles Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.32

content.original:
Early testing of the Flawless proved that the 'Mech was very vulnerable to infantry and light 'Mech attacks due to its slow charging Ion Cannon. The FLW-5G tries to address this by adding six AP Gauss Rifles and changing to a 400 XL core to slightly improve the mobility. Three Light AC/10 provide some sustained firepower for longer fights. Quirk: Accurate Weapon - Missiles Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.32

Arm Actuator Limit: Right Lower

content.original:
The A loadout carries a mix of weapons fit for its role as a medium distance brawler; an LB-X Autocannon 20 in the right arm, one ER PPC, a Large Laser and a Large Pulse Laser in the left arm, and two LRM-20 launchers in the side-torsos. A center torso mounted Advanced Laser AMS provides excellent cover against incoming missile weapons, being mounted next to a Streak SRM-6 for last resort defense. Quirk: Intimidating Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.43

Arm Actuator Limits: Omni

content.original: The Headsman is one of the largest 'Mechs made by the clans. A 190 ton OmniMech with a 450 XXL engine, Ferro-Carbide Lamellor Armor and advanced piloting, firing and EWS systems, it is not a 'Mech you want to see in the opposing forces. It's major downside is it very high cost, making acquiring, fielding and repairing it a huge cost.

content.original:
As an anti-personnel and vehicle configuration, the Headsman B combines the power of a Hyper Assault Gauss Rifle with a Rotary AP Large Bore Gauss Rifle. After the main weapons has fired, hopefully punching a hole through the armor of the enemy, the Headsman B can follow up with several energy weapons to cause further havoc. Quirk: Intimidating Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.43

content.original:
The C loadout's main goal is to disable any foes; either through its Long Tom Cannon with both inferno and thermobaric rounds, or through its two Plasma Cannons and two Tight Stream EMP Cannons. Even the two iATM-12 launchers have EMP ammunition for further disabling. The loadout however has no close range weapons, leaving it very vulnerable to light units assaults unless properly escorted by other friendly forces. Quirk: Intimidating Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.43

Arm Actuator Limits: Omni

content.content: Сверхтяжёлый клановый омнис

content.original: Named after the mythological beings of power that almost rivals the Gods, the Jotunn is a Superheavy OmniMech designed by Clan Coyote. The 'Mech has seen widespread adoption amongst the Home Clans, often serving as the anchor of heavy assault Stars. A 375 XL engine serves as the powerplant, while a XL Omni helps increase the available podspace.

A 375 XL engine serves as the powerplant, while a XL Omni helps increase the available podspace.

content.original: The powerful engines gives the 22E a top speed of nearly 60 km/h, making it one of the fastest 'Mechs of its weight class. Armed with an impressive array of weapons, including a pair of massive Super Heavy Rotary Autocannons and a highly advanced laser system. Its designers also paid close attention to the weapons' distribution, ensuring that the 22K can engage its enemies from a wide range of angles and still maintain a deadly rate of fire. The only variant to be exported to all Great Houses of the Inner Sphere, the King Dragon DRG-22E is the by far most common and largest success of the line. Quirk: Well Balanced Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.3

content.original: Dreadnought
content.content: Дредноут

content.original: The King Dragon is a new addition to the roster of 'Mechs fielded by House Kurita in the Inner Sphere. Developed by the well-known manufacturer, Takara Tomy, this 'Mech was a massive upgrade over the 60-ton Dragon - both considering firepower and survivability. With its imposing size and heavily reinforced armor, the King Dragon was designed to fill the role of the ultimate heavy-hitter on the battlefield, a true Dreadnought. Despite its massive size, the King Dragon is surprisingly agile thanks to its highly balance chassis, making it a formidable opponent even for lighter and more nimble 'Mechs. This agility, combined with its advanced targeting systems and unparalleled firepower, makes the King Dragon a fearsome sight on any battlefield. The King Dragon quickly gained a reputation as one of the most fearsome and unstoppable Superheavy BattleMechs in the Inner Sphere and pilots of the 'Mech quickly became legendary figures in the various wars and conflicts that wracked the region, inspiring awe and fear in equal measure. Overall, the King Dragon is a testament to the engineering prowess of Takara Tomy and the relentless pursuit of new and improved designs to bring to the battlefield.

content.original: The first variant to put into production by the Draconis Combine, the -22K is amongst the more commonly found ones. The powerful engines gives the 22K a top speed of nearly 60 km/h, making it one of the fastest 'Mechs of its weight class. Armed with an impressive array of weapons, including a pair of massive Super Heavy Rotary Autocannons, twin Large X-Pulse Lasers and a still experimental Superheavy Flamer, codenamed 'Ryuujin'. Its designers also paid close attention to the weapons' distribution, ensuring that the 22K can engage its enemies from a wide range of angles and still maintain a deadly rate of fire. Quirk: Well Balanced Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.3

content.original: As the -23K failed to capture the hearts of the DCMS, several units were converted to a more support and command role. Adding a Command Console, Guardian ECM, Active Probe and C3 Master for the price of dropping on of the Snubnose PPCs improved the importance of the 'Mech on the battlefield significantly thanks to it enhanced electronic warfare and command capabilities, turning the -23K-DC into a favoute of the officers of the DCMS. Quirk: Well Balanced Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.3

content.original: The first refresh of the King Dragon, the DRG-23K replaces the two X-Pulse lasers of the -22K with three Snubnose PPC and slightly less heat sinks. The powerful 375 XL engine of the -22K was kept, leaving the a top speed of nearly 60 km/h untouched. Although the switch to the PPCs over lasers was an improvement on paper, many MechWarriors found it to be worse performing in actual battle which left the -23K with a slightly tainted reputation. Quirk: Well Balanced Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.3

content.original: As the -23K was deemed underperforming, the -23K2 was conceived as a quick refit to restore it to be more in line with the better performing earlier specifications of the -22E and -22K. All the PPCs were removed, instead two Large and two Medium X-Pulse Lasers were added. The result once again restored the King Dragon to its much loved position within the DCMS. Quirk: Well Balanced Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.3

content.original: The King Dragon DRG-23N was developed for environments that reduced the efficiency of cooling. Dropping all energy weapons except for a single ER Large Laser and instead mounting a MRM-40 launcher allows the 'Mech to better handle its heat. Quirk: Well Balanced Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.3

content.original: The least common variant of the King Dragon fielded by the Draconis Combine Mustered Soldiery, the -23J is an almost complete redesign. Mounting two huge Booster Jets and a Partial Wing System allows the 'Mech to jump an astounding 180 meters, quickly repositioning for devastating flank or disabling attacks by its three Plasma Cannons and two Ryuujin Superheavy Flamers. Six Magshot rifles also allows the any back strikes to penetrate the armor and do serious damage to the insides of its foes. These changes come at the cost of downgrading the variants engine to a 300 XL core, and lowering the cooling capacity to only 14 heat sinks. Quirk: Well Balanced Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.3
content.prevOriginal: The least common variant of the King Dragon fielded by the Draconis Combine Mustered Soldiery, the -23J is an almost complete redesign. These changes come at the cost of downgrading the variants engine to a 300 XL core, and lowering the cooling capacity to only 14 heat sinks. Quirk: Well Balanced Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.3
content.content: The least common variant of the King Dragon fielded by the Draconis Combine Mustered Soldiery, the -23J is an almost complete redesign. Mounting two huge Booster Jets and a Partial Wing System allows the 'Mech to jump an astounding 180 meters, quickly repositioning for devastating flank or disabling attacks by its three Plasma Cannons and two Ryuujin Superheavy Flamers. Six Magshot rifles also allows the any back strikes to penetrate the armor and do serious damage to the insides of its foes. These changes come at the cost of downgrading the variants engine to a 300 XL core, and lowering the cooling capacity to only 14 heat sinks. Особенность: Well Balanced Множитель стоимости высадки: 1.3

content.original: Dreadnought
content.content: Дредноут

content.original: The King Dragon is a new addition to the roster of 'Mechs fielded by House Kurita in the Inner Sphere. Developed by the well-known manufacturer, Takara Tomy, this 'Mech was a massive upgrade over the 60-ton Dragon - both considering firepower and survivability. With its imposing size and heavily reinforced armor, the King Dragon was designed to fill the role of the ultimate heavy-hitter on the battlefield, a true Dreadnought. Despite its massive size, the King Dragon is surprisingly agile thanks to its highly balance chassis, making it a formidable opponent even for lighter and more nimble 'Mechs. This agility, combined with its advanced targeting systems and unparalleled firepower, makes the King Dragon a fearsome sight on any battlefield. The King Dragon quickly gained a reputation as one of the most fearsome and unstoppable Superheavy BattleMechs in the Inner Sphere and pilots of the 'Mech quickly became legendary figures in the various wars and conflicts that wracked the region, inspiring awe and fear in equal measure. Overall, the King Dragon is a testament to the engineering prowess of Takara Tomy and the relentless pursuit of new and improved designs to bring to the battlefield.

content.original: The -24K is the latest variant in the King Dragon line. Completely foregoing the Superheavy Rotary Autocannons and the Superheavy Flamer, the design is instead centered around a Light Railgun and an Improve Heavy Guass Rifle. Two ER PPC and a Medium Pulse Laser are also able to be mounted by switching to an XXL engine core, trading increased damage potential for higher risk of engine failures due to side torso destructions. Quirk: Well Balanced Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.3

content.original:
The second configuration of the Leliourium, named 'Paimon', is an indirect fire role. The full focus on missiles is very evident with its four Artemis IV FCS supported Rotary LRM-20 launchers in the arms and the Arrow IV mounted in the Left Torso. An advanced ton targeting computer further enhances the 'Mechs capabilities, enabling both improved clustering and multi-target capabilities. The large weakness of the A configuration is the lack of any weapons capable of defensive duties. Quirk: Wrath of Blake Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.39

Arm Actuator Limits: Omni

content.original: Infernal Superheavy
content.content: Адский сверхтяж

content.original: When the news of Precentor Vapula's Celestial series of 'Mechs reached Precentor Destral VII, he refused to have his devotion be outdone. Throwing all available, and unavailable, resources at the task, Precentor Destral VII's design team created the Leliorium, a 200t Omnimech, named after the highest rank of demons in the Ars Goetia, as compared to the Celestial series' angels. Furthering the point that these are not just the Celestials on steroids, each configuration is further named after one of the nine demon kings.  Each one brings to bear the cutting edge of experimental weaponry and armor, such as the Exsecratio Stealth Armor and the Seraphim Electronic Warfare Suite. The final check, before each unit is released from the factory, is a holy blessing by 6 high Blakist Priests, ensuring that the pilot, and 'Mech, are well taken care of by Blake.

content.original:
The 'Asmodeus' is the support fire configuration of the Leliourium. The Thumper mounted in the left torso and the Mortar/8 in the right can together cover huge areas in mines or fire as needed. Four Thunderbolt 20 launchers allow more direct damage, and three pulse lasers brings some more defensive purposes. Quirk: Wrath of Blake Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.39

Arm Actuator Limits: Omni

content.original: The Manx is a ComStar design for an heavy impact superheavy based around Rotary Autocannons of various sizes and types. At 170 ton and using all the weight saving technology there is, an impressive amount of weapons can be fit on the chassis. The arm and shoulder actuators are strengthened to allow for reduction of the weapon recoil. Even the sensor and piloting equipment are top notch, the combination of Vehicular DNI, Angel ECM, Bloodhound Probe and a C3i unit making it near impossible to not perform well with the 'Mech on the battlefield.

content.original:
The original attempt to create a 'Mech around the Mauler Laser, the MO-O1 only served to bring out the major drawback with the experimental laser, its range. The combined heat generation of the Mauler and the four other Large X-Pulse lasers is so great that there is no feasible way to cool the 'Mech without huge investments in hard to acquire technology. Combined with the short range of the Mauler, the prototype proved to be highly unsuccessful. Quirk: Improved Cooling Jacket - Laser Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.28

Arm Actuator Limits: Left Lower, Right Lower

Лимит приводов рук: Left Lower, Right Lower

The -O2 is an attempt to make a design more geared towards the shortcomings of the Mauler Laser, focused on short range weaponry by an UAC/20 and a Streak SRM6. content.original: The Ophanim was created by the Word of Blake to become the keystone of their blessed military forces. Weighting in at 150t and utilizing a 425-rated core, the Ophanim brings Divine Wrath in its arms, and the Blessed Rains in the side torsos.  Those hoping that great weight given to the weaponry has cost it armor protection, will find that the Spirit of Blake has been blessed on this Sanctus Armor, helping to lift the load from those going to preach the Truth under fire.  Included as well, is a Blessed Gyro, and Seraphim EWAR Suite, both given blessings by the highest priests of the order, which has had some positive effects on combat performance. And to drive home the point that this is a model just for those who truly believe, it requires the pilot to have undergone significant cyberfication, to the point of almost embedding them into the cockpit.

content.original: The original variant of the Praetorian is also the most deadly in pure damage output. The design carries a massive Railgun, an almost equally large Naval Laser, an arm-mounted LBX AC/10 and finally two ER Large Lasers. All these weapons mean that damage can still be consistently delivered over most ranges, but due to the quite bad cooling they are not meant to all be fired at the same time.. Quirk: Superheavy Prototype Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.39

content.original: The Praetorian is the ancestor to all other Superheavy 'Mechs. Created at the height of the first Starleague as a sign of power and prestige, it brought a totally new kind of mechanical beast to the battlefield. At 175 tons, it was so much larger than anything previously seen that it is claimed many foes fled as the mere sight of it.

content.original: The Scuti was the largest Superheavy created for most of the Star League Era. Like it's namesake, a hypergiant star amongst the largest known in the universe, the 'Mechs sheer size was very close to the physically possible limit for BattleMechs. With the SLDF's exodus, several of the Scuti were hidden in caches around the galaxy, locations kept extremely safeguarded. Several hundred years later ComStar eventually recovered these giants as their need for increased firepower rose.

content.original:
The X2 drops the Gauss rifles of the X1 to instead mount a massive Railgun. Due to weapons size, both the ECM and active probe had to be dropped and the ER Large Laser was downgraded to a Medium Pulser Laser in the left torso. The increased damage potential was still considered an upgrade, as long as other 'Mechs were able to protect the Scuti from flankers. Quirk: Battle Computer SLDF-X Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.43

Arm Actuator Limits: Left Upper, Right Upper

content.original: The -6M is a bit of a weird take on the Serket, switching from its usual support role to a much more direct design. Six SRM-6 launchers and two Magshot Cannons provide impressive close range fire capabilities, but a downsized Naval Laser mounted on the 'Mech's back can still cause surprising damage at longer ranges of engagement. Quirk: Multi Trac Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.32

content.original: One of the first mass production QuadMechs, the 55 ton Scorpion entered production in 2570 as an infantry support unit. Shunned by most MechWarriors due to it’s notoriously unstable gait, the Scorpion would nevertheless see uninterrupted use throughout the Succession Wars and beyond. The Scoprion 1N is powered by a 330 rated Fusion Core giving it a top speed of 97km/h. A PPC and an SRM-6 form the Mechs weapons load.

content.original: The SG11-J is one of the most mobile superheavies on the modern battlefield, much thanks to the two huge Booster Jets and Partial Wing System allowing the 'Mech to jump up 180 meters despite its massive weight. Because of the massive internal space the jumping equipment fills, not much room for weapons is left over which as a result leads to a weaker loadout; two Superheavy Rotary AC/5 and an Improved Heavy Gauss Rifle. Quirk: Improved Lifesupport Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.4

content.original: The Stone Giant is a 180 ton superheavy developed by Robinson Standard BattleWorks at their main research and development plant on Robinson III, loosely based on the Atlas. It's a very versatile chassis that exists in many variants with different configurations and roles. Although initially sold to Federated Suns only it soon reached new markets all over the Inner Sphere and even some larger Periphery states.

content.original: The Subjugator 1 focuses around its 435 rated XXL fusion engine, to be as mobile as possible and attempting flanking strikes with its huge Improved Railgun and two Extended Range Large Pulse Lasers. To be able to fit such a large fusion core, most of the 'Mech uses very light equipment, making it more susceptible to crippling side torso strikes. Quirk: Intimidating Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.34

content.original: Marksman Juggernaut
content.content: Стрелок-джаггернаут

content.original: The Subjugator is a 120 ton Clan BattleMech with one focus, long range devastating strikes with its Improved Railgun and other weapons. It is slightly less heavily armored than most Superheavy units, but instead relies on other means such as mobility or stealth to be effective in battle. Besides the fixed Improved Railgun in the right torso, the other very interesting thing with the design is the Encased Cybernetic Cockpit; this cockpit encases the piloting MechWarriors in extra thick armor and utilizes a window less design to lower the amount of weakspots.

content.original: The second variant of the Subjugator is probably the most common due to its considerably lower production and maintenance costs. To achieve this cheaper cost, the engine and gyro were downgraded and the targeting computer in the left torso was removed. To scale down the cooling costs the ER Large Pulse Lasers are replaced by Rotary AC/5s, which does mean slightly shorter optimal range for the combined weaponry, but the trade-off to lower the acquirement cost by almost 15 million c-bills is seen as well worth it. Quirk: Intimidating Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.34
content.prevOriginal: The second variant of the Subjugator is probably the most common due to its considerably lower production and maintenance costs. To achieve this cheaper cost, the engine and gyro were downgraded and the targeting computer in the left torso was removed. To scale down the cooling costs the ER Large Pulse Lasers are replaced by Rotary AC/5s, which does mean slightly shorter optimal range for the combined weaponry, but the trade-off to lower the acquirement cost by almost 15 million c-bills is seen as well worth it. Quirk: Intimidating Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.34

Особенность: Устрашающий Множитель стоимости высадки: 1.34

content.content: Стрелок-джаггернаут

content.original: The Subjugator is a 120 ton Clan BattleMech with one focus, long range devastating strikes with its Improved Railgun and other weapons. It is slightly less heavily armored than most Superheavy units, but instead relies on other means such as mobility or stealth to be effective in battle. Besides the fixed Improved Railgun in the right torso, the other very interesting thing with the design is the Encased Cybernetic Cockpit; this cockpit encases the piloting MechWarriors in extra thick armor and utilizes a window less design to lower the amount of weakspots.

content.original: The only variant of the Subjugator with a stealth armor, and as a result the one least like the other variants of the chassis. The ER Large Pulse Lasers have been replaced by two ER PPCs and two Improved Heavy Large Lasers, the engine has been majorly downgraded to a 375 rated fusion core and the amount of armor has been reduced. To handle the increased cooling needs the design utilizes the more expensive Prototype heat sinks. Quirk: Intimidating Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.34

content.original: The last variant of the Subjugator to enter production, but is not significantly more advanced than the other models. A combination of Medium and Large Improved Heavy Lasers together with the Improved Railgun can keep sustained heavy fire going at most ranges if some basic heat management is utilized. Quirk: Intimidating Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.34

content.original: One of the more recent additions to the line, the Subjugator 5 builds on the success of the Subjugator 1 by keeping most of the design the same. The only real difference is the replacement of its two Extended Range Large Pulse Lasers with two Artemis IV-enabled LRM-15 Launchers and two ER Medium Lasers. Quirk: Intimidating Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.34

content.original: The Subjugator 6 mounts a Proto Autocannon/8 in each arm, working in tandem with the Improved Railgun to deliver considerable damage. A single head mounted Medium Pulse Laser is the only non-ballistic weapon, and due to its placement the Angel ECM has been moved to the center torso. This ballistic loadout allows the usual thermal exchanger unit to be replaced by a low-profile active probe suite for enhanced targeting capabilities. Quirk: Intimidating Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.34

In its primary configuration the Summoner has a basic yet effective arsenal. The primary direct fire weapons are four ER PPC backed up by a Rotary AC/10. For fire support and bombardment, the Summoner also has an Arrow IV launcher. Quirk: Command Mech Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.43

Arm Actuator Limits: Omni

content.original: The Kugelblitz, also known as the Hypernova, Superluminous Supernova, or 'Type 1A Supernova' is a gigantic Supernova chassis. Nothing really out of the ordinary until one checks the armor plating on it, mounting WarShip class 'Ferro-Carbide Lamellor', this expensive armor is capable of protecting a 'Mech's internals without issue, but the price to maintain the armor is something even the richest of Clan Diamond Shark might have an issue with.

content.original:
The Tercio 10 os one of the two only variants of the Tercio with jump capabilities, the other being the Tercio 7. Much of the loadout of the Tercio 10 is also similar to the 7, the only real difference is the replacement of the standard LRM launchers with four Streak LRM-10. Quirk: Multi Trac Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.47

Arm Actuator Limits: Left Lower, Right Lower

content.content: Клановый джаггернаут

content.original: The Tercio is the Escorpión_Imperio's flagship BattleMech. The 185 ton behemoth is focused on massive firepower and supporting it with advanced technology to maximize its efficiency. Although constructed only in limited numbers, the Tercio has quickly gained a reputation of being able to overwhelm even the most reinforced of positions.

content.original:
The most recent variant of the Tercio, the 11, mounts a MRM-45 in each side torso. This very rare weapon has previously mainly been seen in the hands of the Society, and it is not clear how the designers got their hands on these weapons. A Rotary AC/10 in each arm finishes the weapons loadout, and two Booster Jets provide extra movement capabilities, as also seen on the Tercio 7 and Tercio 10. Quirk: Multi Trac Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.47

Arm Actuator Limits: Left Lower, Right Lower

content.original:
The combined destructive power of the Tercio 3 is quite impressive with its four arm mounted Large Heavy Improved Lasers and four Large Pulse Lasers - all with attached Laser Insulators. Further, each side torso mounts a Hyper Assault Gauss 20 and a LRM-10 launcher. Using a compact gyro allows the design to even mount some secondary smaller sized lasers, resulting in a total weapons package to rival almost any other 'Mech. Quirk: Multi Trac Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.47

Arm Actuator Limits: Left Lower, Right Lower

content.original:
The Tercio 9 is the lastest design, and is the brain child of Estéfano Salvador Rodriguez de La Mancha, at the time head of the Tercio program. Combining the power of the Improved Heavy Gauss Riles and the Superheavy Rotary Autocannon/5 makes the 'Mech capable of striking most targets with enough force to disable them, even at very long ranges. Three MRM-10 launchers and a Medium Pulse Laser allows dealing with foes at closer ranges. Quirk: Multi Trac Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.47

content.original: The B loadout is fully focused on long range indirect fire support with its two Thumper Artillery and two Artemis V-enabled Rotary LRM-20 launchers. Protected by Stealth Armor and an Angel ECM systems it aims to stay as far out of sight as the 'Mech can, but two ER Large Lasers provide some defensive firepower if truly needed. Quirk: Accurate Weapon - Ballistics Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.36

content.original: The Tian Xie Zuo, named after the Scorpio star constellation seen from Terra, is a 185 ton Superheavy QuadMech designed by the Capellan Confederation. Part of their new doctrine to bring offensive capabilities above all, the design is focused on weapons rather than defensive strength, but still carries an impressive amount of armor.

content.original:
The -C1 was designed in response to both A and B series of the Uberjager not meeting the customer's needs. With this new line of designs, Independence Weaponry again returns to adding secondary weapons by popular request, in the form of Light PPCs and Small Pulse Lasers, in addition the the main armaments of four Superheavy Rotary AC/2. As a last touch, to enable fitting all the heavy weaponry the engine has been upgraded to an XXL. Quirk: Accurate Weapon - Ballistics Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.27

Arm Actuator Limits: Left Upper, Right Upper

content.original: Take a basic Jagermech, make it even bigger, and you have Independence Weaponry's Uberjager. A 115 ton beast of raw ballistic damage, it is entirely focused on autocannons and their auxiliary systems.

content.original:
The -C1b is not really related to the -C1 model, despite its name. Instead of the C1 energy weapons, the C1B brings four Superheavy Rotary AC/2 and a center torso mounted Light Gauss Rifle. This refit was created due to a shortage of key components as Independence Weaponry got in a contract dispute with Energy Unlimited Corporation, their subcontractor for certain energy weapon subsystems. In an attempt to save weight, the Uberjager -C1b also upgrades to a 285 XXL engine. Quirk: Accurate Weapon - Ballistics Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.27

Arm Actuator Limits: Left Upper, Right Upper

content.original:
The C loadout is focused around its massive Railgun, with two Superheavy Rotary AC/5 to provide even more raw damage. Although the configuration does have a few Lasers as well, they are purely secondary. The major drawback of this configuration is the risk of it falling over due to the massive recoil of its weapons if an inexperienced pilot is controlling it. Quirk: Extended Torso Twist Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.32

Arm Actuator Limits: Omni

content.original: Superheavy OmniMech
content.content: Сверхтяжёлый омнимех

content.original: When the Capellan Confederation needed a new 'Mech to export, House Liao decided the easiest and cheapest way was to "acquire" the design of the Sunder OmniMech from a certain neighbor Inner Sphere state. To prevent any accusations about using their design without permissions, House Liao scientists then decided to simply upscale the design and make it a superheavy. This is how the 165 ton Wannu OmniMech was born, which then was exported to both the Lyrans and the Suns. Some even found their way back to the Draconis Combine, although House Kurita did refuse to buy any directly for some reason.

content.original: The Yari is a Draconis Combine designed superheavy loosely based on the Orochi. The 145 ton 'Mech mounts a chassis-attached special type of experimental missile launcher which rotating tubes. Although this allows firing of far more missiles, the bulk and weight of the system means the rest of the design is left with little to no defensive capabilities and mobility. To add on top of this, there is also a reliability issue with the launchers which tend to cause both jamming and misfires.

This was seen as an decent trade, as the LBX proved the more useful weapon during the design's trials. Quirk: Accurate Weapon - Missiles Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.33

content.content: Сверхтяжёлый ракетоноситель

content.original: The Yari is a Draconis Combine designed superheavy loosely based on the Orochi. The 145 ton 'Mech mounts a chassis-attached special type of experimental missile launcher which rotating tubes. Although this allows firing of far more missiles, the bulk and weight of the system means the rest of the design is left with little to no defensive capabilities and mobility. To add on top of this, there is also a reliability issue with the launchers which tend to cause both jamming and misfires.

content.original: Produced by some unknown entity in the outer periphery, the Yin-Yang superheavy 'Mech is surprisingly sophisticated. Built around the weapons called Yin and Yang, likely from the same unknown manufacturer, the focus of the 'Mech is long range support, evident by its undersized engine.

content.original: Hunt: The Howl of the Beast
content.prevOriginal: Hunt: The Howl of the Beast
content.content: Hunt: вой зверя

content.original: Commander, our spies have given us intelligence of a {TEAM_TAR.FactionDef.Name} prototype super-heavy 'Mech on {TGT_SYSTEM.Name}. In their last transmission, they spoke of a terrifying thing that sounds like a thunderstorm when it spins up its barrels. We don't take such claims lightly and we'd like your people to deploy a strike force to deal with this monster.
content.prevOriginal: Commander, our spies have given us intelligence of a {TEAM_TAR.FactionDef.Name} prototype super-heavy 'Mech on {TGT_SYSTEM.Name}. In their last transmission, they spoke of a terrifying thing that sounds like a thunderstorm when it spins up its barrels. We don't take such claims lightly and we'd like your people to deploy a strike force to deal with this monster.
content.content: Командир, наши шпионы передали нам информацию о прототипе сверхтяжелого меха от {TEAM_TAR.FactionDef.Name} на {TGT_SYSTEM.Name}. В своей последней передаче они говорили об ужасающей штуке, которая звучит как гром, когда раскручивает свои стволы. Мы не относимся к подобным заявлениям легкомысленно и хотели бы, чтобы ваши люди развернули ударную группу, чтобы разобраться с этим монстром.

content.original: Commander. This is a very bad idea, I heard Wang and his brother Yang worked on this 'Mech's design together, and when he heard the description, he turned pale and called his brother. For him to do that is a terrible sign of what's to come if we pursue this any further.
content.prevOriginal: Commander. This is a very bad idea, I heard Wang and his brother Yang worked on this 'Mech's design together, and when he heard the description, he turned pale and called his brother. For him to do that is a terrible sign of what's to come if we pursue this any further.
content.content: Командир. Это очень плохая идея, я слышал, что Ванг и его брат Ян вместе работали над проектом этого меха, и когда он услышал описание, то побледнел и позвал своего брата. Для него это знак, что что-то плохое произойдёт, если мы продолжим.

content.original: Incoming transmission from {TEAM_TAR.FactionDef.Name}: *static* OK, we promised the big rewards, its the time now. You should know the rules by now, we give what we want, no negotiations. Just beware, this might not be as f-*static*-ing easy as other times, but that shouldn't any problem? RIGHT COMMANDER!?
content.prevOriginal: Incoming transmission from {TEAM_TAR.FactionDef.Name}: *static* OK, we promised the big rewards, its the time now. You should know the rules by now, we give what we want, no negotiations. Just beware, this might not be as f-*static*-ing easy as other times, but that shouldn't any problem? RIGHT COMMANDER!?
content.content: Входящая передача от {TEAM_TAR.FactionDef.Name}: *помехи*... Хорошо, мы обещали большую награду, и вот время пришло. К настоящему моменту вы уже должны понимать правила: мы даём то, что хотим, и никаких переговоров. Только учтите, это может быть не так легко, как в другие разы, но ведь это и не проблема для вас? ВЕРНО, КОМАНДИР?

content.original: We received this suspicious transmission on the late hours of the night Commander. The decrypted message is incomplete and somehow the sender's name is fake, even its HPG ID which was sent doesn't exist. It's similar to other transmission that have been going around, but they seems serious this time.
content.prevOriginal: We received this suspicious transmission on the late hours of the night Commander. It's similar to other transmission that have been going around, but they seems serious this time.
content.content: Мы получили эту подозрительную передачу поздно ночью, командир. Расшифрованное сообщение неполное, имя отправителя поддельное, даже HPG ID отправителя не существует. Это напоминает те другие сообщения, которые нам попадались, но на этот раз всё выглядит серьёзно.

content.content: Входящая передача от {TEAM_TAR.FactionDef.Name}: *помехи*... Сделайте это для нас как акт доброй воли, ко*помехи*дир, и мы обещаем большую награду в будущих *помехи*... content.original: We received this suspicious transmission on the late hours of the night Commander. The decrypted message is incomplete and somehow the sender's name is fake, even its HPG ID which was sent doesn't exist. We don't know anything about what we are gonna find.
content.prevOriginal: We received this suspicious transmission on the late hours of the night Commander. The decrypted message is incomplete and somehow the sender's name is fake, even its HPG ID which was sent doesn't exist. We don't know anything about what we are gonna find.

content.original: The Alpha configuration of the Arachnid aims to provide indirect fire support, while still being able to survive staying near the frontline. Two huge Thunderbolt 20 launchers and four Streak LRM-20 launchers provide an impressive missile volley capability, able to overload even the most advanced anti-missile systems. Two center torso mounted Large ER Pulse Lasers allow some direct fire options as need arises, and a newly designed clan version of the Angel ECM enables electronic warfare support. To free up the weight capacity needed the armor has been converted to the latest Titano-Carbide Lamellor. Quirk: Intimidating Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.45
content.prevOriginal: The Alpha configuration of the Arachnid aims to provide indirect fire support, while still being able to survive staying near the frontline. Two huge Thunderbolt 20 launchers and four Streak LRM-20 launchers provide an impressive missile volley capability, able to overload even the most advanced anti-missile systems. Two center torso mounted Large ER Pulse Lasers allow some direct fire options as need arises, and a newly designed clan version of the Angel ECM enables electronic warfare support. To free up the weight capacity needed the armor has been converted to the latest Titano-Carbide Lamellor. Quirk: Intimidating Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.45
content.content: The Alpha configuration of the Arachnid aims to provide indirect fire support, while still being able to survive staying near the frontline. Two huge Thunderbolt 20 launchers and four Streak LRM-20 launchers provide an impressive missile volley capability, able to overload even the most advanced anti-missile systems. Two center torso mounted Large ER Pulse Lasers allow some direct fire options as need arises, and a newly designed clan version of the Angel ECM enables electronic warfare support. To free up the weight capacity needed the armor has been converted to the latest Titano-Carbide Lamellor. Особенность: Устрашающий Множитель стоимости высадки: 1.45

content.original: In an attempt to at lower the costs of the Arachnid primary configuration somewhat yet keep its alpha strike potential, the B loadout replaces the three Railguns with six standard Gauss Rifles and a total of 8 tons of Gauss ammunition. The two Extended Range PPCs were moved from the head to the center torso to benefit from the Quad Turret Mount. Quirk: Intimidating Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.45

content.original: The two massive railguns defines the Arachnid's primary configuration, both in appearance and in design. Even with the railguns taking up almost two thirds of the available internal space and weight capacity in the giant QuadMech, two ER PPC and an ER Large laser are mounted in the center torso to provide even more firepower. Using 33.5 tons of the latest Titano-Carbide Lamellor armor still allows more than enough armor to survive even the strongest attacks with just minor damages. Quirk: Intimidating Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.45

content.original: The Atrax 4 keeps the twin railguns of the Atrax 1, but replaces the Gauss rifle with a miniaturized version of a Naval Laser. It is unknown where the laser originates from, as it is not a normal weapon to see amongst the Clans. Quirk: Multi Trac Drop Cost Multiplier: 1.5
